Hundreds Laid Off in Bekasi as Sanken, Yamaha Shut Down Plants
body: Hundreds lose jobs in Bekasi as factory closures, including Sanken and Yamaha, trigger mass layoffs across the manufacturing sector.

title: Government to Introduce Single Price Policy for Subsidized LPG
body: Under the planned policy, the government would adopt a logistics-based pricing model to unify LPG prices nationwide.

title: Australia Hopes To Be Indonesia’s Lithium Supplier Ahead of Trade Pact Review
body: World's largest lithium producer Australia wants to include critical mineral cooperation in its trade deal with Indonesia.

title: Indonesia Says an Unnamed Country Has Been Postponing Its Trade Deal Due to Deficit
body: Asked if he was referring to the United States as Indonesia inched closer to the July 9 tariff talks deadline, the minister did not respond.

title: Indonesia Aims for More Competitive US Tariffs than Vietnam’s 20% Deal
body: Trump announced the revised deal on Truth Social on Thursday, saying it was the result of direct talks with Vietnam’s top leader, To Lam.

title: Indonesian Bus Assembler Eyes Sri Lanka for Export Expansion
body: Laksana has previously exported over 200 buses to countries such as Fiji, Bangladesh, Timor-Leste, and Laos.

title: Indonesia Offers $34 Billion in US Imports to Secure Tariff Relief
body: The aim, according to Airlangga, is to help address the US trade deficit with Indonesia, which currently stands at around $19 billion.

title: UK Helps Indonesia Unlock $1 Billion Green Investments
body: Mentari, a UK-backed program, has assisted the coal-reliant Indonesia in making its renewable energy sector more attractive to investors.

title: Danantara, Saudi Arabia’s ACWA Power Unveil $10 Billion Partnership
body: According to Danantara, ACWA Power will explore investments in Indonesia's renewable energy generation, water desalination, among others.

title: Del Monte, 139-Year-Old Canned Food Maker, Files for Bankruptcy
body: Del Monte, known for its canned fruits and vegetables, has filed for bankruptcy protection as consumers turn to healthier, cheaper options.

title: Prabowo Secures $27 Billion Business Deals from Saudi’s MBS Talks
body: The state-run oil company Pertamina and Saudi Arabia's ACWA Power agreed to jointly develop clean energy projects of up to 500 megawatts.

title: Microsoft Cuts 9,000 Jobs, Marking Biggest Layoffs Since 2023
body: Microsoft cuts about 9,000 jobs, its largest layoff in two years, impacting Xbox, sales, and other divisions as it pivots to AI.

title: Trump Tariff Countdown: $82.3 Billion Cost Looms for US Employers
body: An analysis finds Trump’s tariffs could cost U. employers $82.3 billion as a July 9 deadline nears.

title: Manufacturing Slump Deepens as Indonesia’s PMI Drops to 46.9
body: Indonesia’s manufacturing PMI fell to 46.9 in June, signaling deeper contraction and raising concerns over weakening demand.

title: Trade Ministry Eases Import Rules but Tightens Textile Oversight
body: Indonesia eases imports while maintaining strict textile oversight, aiming to boost efficiency and protect domestic industries.

title: Indonesia Hopes to Join BRICS-Backed New Development Bank
body: The New Development Bank (NDB) has approved $39 billion in financing for infrastructure and clean energy projects, among others.

title: Klaten–Prambanan Toll Opens Wednesday with No Toll Fee
body: With the operation of the Klaten-Prambanan segment, the total operational length of the Solo-Yogyakarta Toll Road now reaches 80.8 km.

title: Indonesia Awaits US Feedback on Tariff as Washington Deals with Trump's Big Bill
body: Senior minister Airlangga Hartarto says that Indonesia has already made a second offer to Trump's team in the tariff talks.

title: Tesla Shares Take a Hit As Feud Between Trump and Musk Reaches a Boil
body: Shares of Tesla have already tumbled more than 20 percent this year as worldwide sales of the company’s vehicles erode.

title: Finance Minister: Indonesia's Tax Revenue Unlikely to Meet 2025 Target
body: Among the headwinds is the government’s decision to cancel the planned increase in the value-added tax (VAT) from 11% to 12%.

title: Indonesia’s Palm Oil Exports Surge 27.89% with Pakistan, India as Top Buyers
body: From a volume standpoint, Indonesia's exports of crude palm oil and its derivatives totaled 8.30 million tons in January-May 2025.

title: Indonesia’s Government Debt Jumps 47% in First Half of 2025
body: The 2025 state budget sets a full-year debt target of Rp 775.9 trillion ($47.9 billion).

title: BPS: Rice, Chili Push Indonesia’s Inflation to 0.19% in June
body: Indonesia’s June inflation rises 0.19%, driven by higher rice, chili, and shallot prices, with year-to-date inflation at 1.38%.

title: Indonesia’s Surplus with US Jumps to $7 Billion as Trump’s Tariffs Loom
body: Indonesia’s exports to the US amounted to around $12.11 billion so far this year

title: Harvey Moeis Loses Appeal, Faces 20 Years in Prison for Massive Tin Corruption
body: Indonesia’s Supreme Court rejects Harvey Moeis’ appeal, upholding his 20-year prison term in a major tin trade corruption case.

title: Indonesia Posts $4.30 Billion Surplus, 61-Month Positive Streak
body: Indonesia’s monthly trade surplus is now back in billions after dropping to a record low of just $160 million in April.

title: Garuda Indonesia to Expand Fleet, Routes as Shareholders Approve Restructuring
body: Garuda Indonesia shareholders approve continued restructuring and a board reshuffle as the airline targets post-pandemic expansion.

title: Energy Ministry Proposes Up to $6.5 Billion in Electricity Subsidies for 2026
body: Indonesia plans up to $6.5 billion in 2026 electricity subsidies, targeting low-income households.

title: Pertamina Raises Non-Subsidized Fuel Prices Across Indonesia
body: Pertamina raises non-subsidized fuel prices across Indonesia effective July 1, with Pertamax and diesel prices increasing.

title: President Prabowo Inaugurates Danantara Headquarters in Jakarta
body: President Prabowo inaugurates Danantara Indonesia's new headquarters in Jakarta as the agency expands efforts to drive investment and growth

title: Agriculture Minister to Expose 212 Rice Brands for Alleged Mislabeling and Price Gouging
body: Violations include mislabeling lower-quality rice as premium, selling above the government’s price ceiling, and operating without licenses.

title: JCI Tracks Wall Street Gains as Investors Await Key Economic Data
body: JCI edges up tracking Wall Street gains as investors await US jobs data, Fed signals, and China PMI for cues on rates and growth outlook.

title: Indonesia Eases Import Rules on 10 Products to Support Industries, Growth
body: The deregulation is part of a broader economic reform package designed to simplify bureaucracy, reduce costs, and stimulate growth.

title: China Lifts Nearly 2-Year Ban on Seafood from Japan over Fukushima Wastewater
body: The ban will remain in place for seafood from 10 of Japan's 47 prefectures, including Fukushima and nearby ones.

title: Over 1,500 Australian Dairy Cows Arrive in Indonesia
body: Indonesia is importing Australian dairy cows to boost its milk production.

title: Bali Governor Says Hotel Occupancy Surging, Denies Mass Layoffs in Tourism Sector
body: Last year, the island welcomed 6.4 million international tourists and 9.5 million domestic visitors.

title: West Java’s Upcoming Battery Plant to Power 300,000 EVs Annually
body: The Karawang plant will be fully integrated with five supporting facilities and upstream mining operations located in East Halmahera.

title: Indonesia Begins Construction of $5.9 Billion Mega EV Battery Hub With China’s CATL Consortium
body: The battery plant in Karawang will be integrated with five supporting facilities and upstream operations in East Halmahera, North Maluku.

title: Indonesia to Legalize Marginal Oil Wells with 20,000 bpd Potential
body: The new ministerial regulation is set to take effect on July 3, providing a legal framework for small-scale, individually operated wells.

title: Truckers Forced to Overload or Lose Orders as Indonesia Cracks Down on ODOL
body: Truckers face losing orders if they don’t overload, as Indonesia moves to enforce an ODOL ban to curb Rp 43.5T in annual road damage.
